pullRequest.body:
This PR defines flooring and ceiling division as the right and left adjoints to the map
`b ↦ a • b`.


---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7464534109/job/20311727370)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7464534109/job/20311727640)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7464534109/job/20311726783)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
I was somehow hoping that this would follow automatically... do you have an explanation for why it doesn't? Or maybe it is automatic for positive `a`, but this axiom demands it for all `a`?

Yes exactly. I can't derive the result for negative `a` when `α` is not a field (maybe I missed something, but I doubt so). Given that I care about `α := Nat`, I thought it would be easier to simply add an axiom.
I guess there are quite reasonable settings in which one has both a `FloorDiv` and a `CeilDiv`, and I expect that in that case `FloorDiv \le CeilDiv`. Could you please add a lemma about that?
Can this be generalized such that it applies to `Int`?
Note you can already divide integers by natural numbers with this. The question is to divide by negative integers. Which convention should it use? E-div, F-div, T-div?
Why not the one that `/` already uses on integers?
My point is not so much that I could choose a convention but rather than I should not be the one choosing the convention!

```suggestion
  floorDiv f a := f.mapRange (· ⌊/⌋ a) <| zero_floorDiv _
```
bors r-

bors d+

```suggestion
  ceilDiv f a := f.mapRange (· ⌈/⌉ a) <| by simp
```
